title.justification: Title of the research paper as provided.

extractions.description: The paper discusses AI trustworthiness assessment, covering a range of topics from datasets' qualification to risk and performance evaluations, and the necessity of incorporating trust as a key design principle rather than an option. Different attributes and methodologies to measure and ensure trust in AI systems are examined.

type.justification: The paper covers empirical methods and tools to assess AI trustworthiness in various phases of the lifecycle of AI systems.
type.quote: The expected attributes and the expected values for these attributes depend on contextual elements such as the level of criticality of the application, the application domain of the AI-based system, the expected use, the nature of the stakeholders involved, etc.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on assessing the trustworthiness of AI systems.
name.quote: The goal of this symposium is to establish and grow a community of research and practitioners for AI trustworthiness assessment leveraged by AI sciences, system and software engineering, metrology, and Social Sciences and Humanities (SSH).

name.justification: Machine Learning is discussed in the context of trustworthiness, performance indicators, and risks.
name.quote: “An overview of key trustworthiness attributes and KPIs for trusted ML-based systems engineering”—Juliette Mattioli, Henri Sohier, Agnes Delaborde, Kahina Amokrane-Ferka, AfefAwadid, Zakaria Chihani, Souhaiel Khalfaoui, Gabriel Pedroza

name.justification: Computer Vision is a sub-field discussed in terms of applications like object detection and real-time weather monitoring.
name.quote: “Neighborhood Sampling Confidence Metric for Object Detection”—Christophe Gouguenheim, Ahmad Berjaoui

name.justification: NLP is discussed in the context of rating the trustworthiness of text processing services.
name.quote: “Advances in Automatically Rating the Trustworthiness of Text Processing Services”—Biplav Srivastava, Kausik Lakkaraju, Mariana Bernagozzi, Marco Valtorta

name.justification: ScrutinAI is mentioned as a tool used for visual inspection of DNN performance in a medical use case.
name.quote: “Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case”—Rebekka Görge, Elena Haedecke, Michael Mock

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not indicate that ScrutinAI is a novel contribution of the research but rather used in an existing use case.
is_contributed.quote: “Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case”—Rebekka Görge, Elena Haedecke, Michael Mock

is_executed.justification: Being a tool for visual inspection, it is likely that the model was executed.
is_executed.quote: “Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case”—Rebekka Görge, Elena Haedecke, Michael Mock

is_compared.justification: There is no mention of a comparison with other models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: “Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case”—Rebekka Görge, Elena Haedecke, Michael Mock

referenced_paper_title.value: Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case
referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced paper title mentioning the use of ScrutinAI.
referenced_paper_title.quote: “Using ScrutinAI for Visual Inspection of DNN Performance in a Medical Use Case”—Rebekka Görge, Elena Haedecke, Michael Mock

name.justification: QI2 is mentioned as an interactive tool for data quality assurance.
name.quote: “QI2—an Interactive Tool for Data Quality Assurance”—Simon Geerkens, Christian Sieberichs, Alexander Braun, Thomas Waschulzik
